document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Barsaurea Volynkin & Huang, 2019, with a description of new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lyclene diehli
Dubatolov & Bucsek, 2014
, Amurian Zoological Journal 6 (2): 179, pl. 5, fig. 5 (adult), pl. 6, fig. 10 (male genitalia) ( Type locality: “ North Sumatra / Sindar Raya / 98°57’ ö .L.; 3°09’ n .B.”).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Barsaurea
spp., adults. Depositories of specimens: 1—NHMUK (©); 2—ZFMK; 3, 4, 6, 7, 8—MWM/ZSM; 5—SZMN.

FIGURES 9–16.
Barsaurea
spp., adults. Depositories of specimens: 9, 10, 12, 14, 16—MWM/ZSM; 11, 15—CAV; 13— SCAU.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Forewing length is 11.5– 14 mm in males and 12.5– 13 mm in females. The species varies in its size and expression of forewing markings. A reliable identification of males from those of the sympatric
B. ketiga
sp. n.
is possible by the genital structures only. Female of
B. diehli
can be distinguished from that of
B. ketiga
sp. n.
by its broader and more diffuse forewing markings. In the male genitalia, the number of spines in aedeagus vesica in specimens dissected varies from 6 to 11. The genital differences between
B. diehli
and
B. ketiga
sp. n.
are given in the diagnosis of the latter.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–20.
Barsaurea phaeoxanthia
, male genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 17—ZFMK; 18–20—MWM/ZSM.

FIGURES 21–24.

, male genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 21—SZMN; 22–24—MWM/ZSM.

FIGURES 25–28.
Barsaurea ketiga
sp. n.
, male genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 25–27—MWM/ZSM; 28—SCAU.

FIGURES 29–32.
Barsaurea ketiga
sp. n.
, male genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 29—MWM/ZSM; 30–32—CAV.

FIGURES 33–36.
Barsaurea
spp., female genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 33, 36—MWM/ZSM; 35—CAV; fig. 34 is given after
Bayarsaikhan et al. (2018)
.

FIGURES 37–40.
Barsaurea ketiga
sp. n.
, female genitalia. Depositories of specimens: 37, 38—MWM/ZSM; 39—SCAU; 40—CAV.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution . Indonesia ( Sumatra Island) ( Dubatolov & Bucsek 2014 ), Peninsular Malaysia ( Bucsek 2014 , as
B. phaeoxanthia
partly), Cambodia (
Bae et al. 2016
;
Bayarsaikhan et al. 2018
, as
B. phaeoxanthia
), Myanmar ( Kachin State ) and Laos ( Champasak Province ).
